item.title: How to use Pixel 10 Pro’s Camera Coach

review.headline_rewrite: How to use Pixel 10 Pro’s Camera Coach
bullets: - First, make sure you’re connected to data or Wi-Fi because Camera Coach uses some cloud-based Gemini models to give you the best, most relevant suggestions.
Choose a point of focus from this list, ask Camera Coach to give you some inspiration or rescan the scene entirely to try again.

item.title: Netflix CPO Eunice Kim joins TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 to talk scaling product and reimagining entertainment

review.headline_rewrite: Netflix CPO Eunice Kim joins TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 to talk scaling product and reimagining entertainment
bullets: From a DVD-by-mail startup to a global streaming powerhouse with 300M+ subscribers, Netflix has changed how the world consumes entertainment.
At Disrupt, happening at Moscone West in San Francisco, we’ll hear from the executive driving that next chapter: Eunice Kim, Netflix’s chief product officer.
Her team is also pioneering new tools for creators, powering content production “from pitch to play” with technology that supports storytellers worldwide.
With past leadership roles at Google Play, YouTube, PepsiCo, Adobe, and startups, Kim knows what it takes to scale products that reach millions while transforming industries behind the scenes.
At Disrupt, she’ll share insights on the intersection of product innovation, creative technology, and global commerce strategy.

Join the celebration
This is just one of many conversations waiting for you at Disrupt, alongside 10,000+ founders, investors, and tech leaders.

item.title: How to watch Apple announce the iPhone 17

review.headline_rewrite: How to watch Apple announce the iPhone 17
bullets: The company is expected to announce its iPhone 17 lineup, which could include a slimmer version, as well as updates for the Apple Watch and AirPods.
Taking center stage is the rumored iPhone 17 Air, which could replace the Plus model and would be notably thinner than any previous iPhone model.
It’s also speculated to include a 24-megapixel front camera.
Apple may also provide more details about the public release of iOS 26, which introduces a Liquid Glass interface that offers a more transparent look.

item.title: Instagram is coming to iPad, 15 years later

review.headline_rewrite: Instagram is coming to iPad, 15 years later
bullets: From this perspective, opening the app straight to Reels makes perfect sense.

Other features will be available on iPad: Stories will still line the top of the homepage, and users will be able to switch to a “Following” tab where they’ll be able to swipe between feeds that more resemble the mobile Instagram experience (including a chronological option).
Instagram head Adam Mosseri has said in the past that the group of people wanting an iPad app just wasn’t big enough for it to be a top priority.

item.title: Google’s best-ever 4K streamer is within $1 of its lowest price

review.headline_rewrite: Google’s best-ever 4K streamer is within $1 of its lowest price
bullets:
Google’s best-ever 4K streamer is within $1 of its lowest price
Google’s TV Streamer 4K doubles as a smart home hub with support for Matter.
Google’s terrific TV Streamer (4K) is the company’s best attempt at a streaming device yet, with built-in ethernet, an excellent interface, and smart home compatibility with both Matter and Thread.
Read our review.

item.title: PayPal and Venmo users get a free year of Perplexity Pro and early access to its AI browser

review.headline_rewrite: PayPal and Venmo users get a free year of Perplexity Pro and early access to its AI browser
bullets: Perplexity, the NVIDIA- and Bezos-backed AI company, is partnering with PayPal to get its Comet browser in front of millions of the financial tech giant's users.

The deal will see PayPal and Venmo customers in the US and select international markets gain access to the AI-powered browser, as well as a free 12-month subscription to Perplexity Pro, which normally costs $200.
PayPal users in the US can claim their free 12-month Perplexity Pro subscription from the PayPal app today.
The Comet browser was in beta testing earlier this summer before launching in July as part of Perplexity's $200-per-month Max subscription.
Perplexity's AI is integrated into Comet and serves as the browser's default search engine.

This incorporation allows users to pull up the AI in a sidebar to ask questions about what they see on screen, summarize text and even take actions on behalf of the user, like sending an email or looking up directions on Google Maps.
